Class InputDialogBuilder

java.lang.Object
application.framework.builders.InputDialogBuilder
public class InputDialogBuilder extends Object
Builder for a pop‑out dialog containing a single TextField and OK/Cancel buttons.

Allows custom title, header, placeholder, pre‑filled text, field width, and validator. Call showAndWait() to block and retrieve the user‑entered value.

    • attachValidator

      public InputDialogBuilder attachValidator(Predicate<String> v, String errMessage)
      Adds an optional validator. Provide a predicate that returns true for valid input. If validation fails the OK button stays disabled and showAndWaitValidated() will throw IllegalArgumentException with the supplied message.

    • build

      public javafx.scene.control.Dialog<String> build()

    • showAndWait

      public Optional<String> showAndWait()
      builds, shows and waits, returning the string or empty if cancelled.

      No need to call this. Automatically called by UIFactory.showTextInput(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.util.function.Consumer<application.framework.builders.InputDialogBuilder>...).

    • showAndWaitValidated

      public Optional<String> showAndWaitValidated()
      Same as showAndWait() but enforces validation. If the user presses OK with invalid input an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

      No need to call this. Automatically called by UIFactory.showTextInput(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.String>, java.lang.String, java.util.function.Consumer<application.framework.builders.InputDialogBuilder>...).

    • with

      public InputDialogBuilder with(Consumer<javafx.scene.control.TextArea> cfg)
